Perinatal Hepatitis B Prevention Program
Find resources to manage, support, and prevent perinatal, or mother-to-baby, transmission of hepatitis B virus infection.
About Public Health Services
Public Health has over 170 years of
history
in San Diego County. Public Health Services (PHS) is the local health
 department. We operate within the County of San Diego's Health and
 Human Services Agency. The vision of PHS is
Healthy People in
 Healthy and Equitable Communities.
This vision is achieved
 through our mission to promote health and improve quality of life. We
 achieve this by preventing disease, injury, and disability. We also
 protect against, and respond to, health threats and disasters. PHS is
 guided by the values of Diversity, Respect, Collaboration,
 Responsiveness, and Transparency.
What We Do:
We:
Help prevent the spread of disease,
Protect against
 environmental hazards,
Prevent injuries,
Promote
 healthy behaviors,
Help communities recover from disaster,
 and
Make sure the quality and ease of access of health
 services throughout the county.
The PHS Administration branch offers support to the six branches
 and their related programs. They are also responsible for
 coordinating a unified response from the department.
